title: Simply-typed constant-domain modal lambda calculus I: distanced beta reduction and combinatory logic
abstract:
Abstract.
A system 𝝀υsubscript𝝀𝜐\boldsymbol{\lambda}_{\upsilon} is developed that combines modal logic and simply-typed lambda calculus, and that generalizes the system studied by Montague and Gallin. Whereas Montague and Gallin worked with Church’s simple theory of types, the system 𝝀υsubscript𝝀𝜐\boldsymbol{\lambda}_{\upsilon} is developed in the typed base theory most commonly used today, namely the simply-typed lambda calculus. Further, the system 𝝀υsubscript𝝀𝜐\boldsymbol{\lambda}_{\upsilon} is controlled by a parameter υ𝜐\upsilon which allows more options for state types and state variables than is present in Montague and Gallin. A main goal of the paper is to establish the basic metatheory of 𝝀υsubscript𝝀𝜐\boldsymbol{\lambda}_{\upsilon}: (i) a completeness theorem is proven for β​η𝛽𝜂\beta\eta-reduction, and (ii) an Andrews-like characterization of Henkin models in terms of combinatory logic is given; and this involves a distanced version of β𝛽\beta-reduction and a 𝖡𝖢𝖪𝖶𝖡𝖢𝖪𝖶\mathsf{BCKW}-like basis rather than 𝖲𝖪𝖨𝖲𝖪𝖨\mathsf{SKI}-like basis. Further, conservation of the maximal system 𝝀ωsubscript𝝀𝜔\boldsymbol{\lambda}_{\omega} over 𝝀υsubscript𝝀𝜐\boldsymbol{\lambda}_{\upsilon} is proven, and expressibility of 𝝀ωsubscript𝝀𝜔\boldsymbol{\lambda}_{\omega} in 𝝀υsubscript𝝀𝜐\boldsymbol{\lambda}_{\upsilon} is proven; thus these modal logics are highly expressive. Similar results are proven for the relation between 𝝀ωsubscript𝝀𝜔\boldsymbol{\lambda}_{\omega} and 𝝀𝝀\boldsymbol{\lambda}, the corresponding ordinary simply-typed lambda calculus. This answers a question of Zimmerman in the simply-typed setting. In a companion paper this is extended to Church’s simple theory of types.
